name: ax8v
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2))))

stmt.origin: a1ii(wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)))), diffss(s0, s1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2))))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2))))
-| diffss(s0, s1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2))))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2))))
-| diffss(s0, s1)

body.origin: |- wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2))))
-| diffss(s0, s1)

comment: Weakened version of ~ ax-8 , with a disjoint variable condition on ` x , y ` . This should be the only proof referencing ~ ax-8 , and it should be referenced only by its two weakened versions ~ ax8v1 and ~ ax8v2 , from which ~ ax-8 is then rederived as ~ ax8 , which shows that either ~ ax8v or the conjunction of ~ ax8v1 and ~ ax8v2 is sufficient. (Contributed by BJ, 7-Dec-2020.) Use ~ ax8 instead. (New usage is discouraged.)
